transportAdvice: The Algarve has a regional bus network connecting major towns and coastal resorts, though services can be infrequent in rural areas, making a rental car the most practical option for exploring the region. Taxis and ride-hailing are available in larger towns like Faro, Albufeira, and Lagos, and many resort areas are walkable once you arrive.

weather.description: Mild winter days with occasional rain showers; quiet and uncrowded, good for sightseeing but not beach weather.
Still cool and occasionally wet, but almond blossoms begin to appear inland, offering scenic countryside walks.
Temperatures begin to rise and spring flowers bloom; rain is still possible but sunny days become more frequent.
Pleasant spring weather with warm days and low rainfall; ideal for hiking, cycling, and early-season beach visits.
Warm and largely dry with long sunny days; beaches begin to fill and the sea starts to warm up.
Hot and sunny with very little rain; excellent beach weather and the start of the busy summer tourist season.
Peak summer heat with virtually no rain; beaches are at their busiest and the sea is warm for swimming.
The hottest month of the year with intense sunshine; expect large crowds at popular beaches and resorts.
Still warm and sunny with slightly fewer crowds; one of the best months to visit for comfortable beach weather.
Temperatures cool noticeably and rain returns occasionally; quieter atmosphere with good conditions for outdoor activities.
Mild but increasingly wet and overcast; tourist crowds thin out significantly and prices drop.
Cool winter weather with regular rainfall; a quiet time to visit with a relaxed local atmosphere and low prices.
